properties.media:imagetext:
No one raised any objection. In this provinc
urg is raised like
anyother crop and there is apparently no attempt at all made to stop
the smoking of it. In this particylar place the house opened right
on the street or rather path which leads through a small Chinese vil-
lage on the way to the Standard Oil residence. The men inside were
either asleep or smoking. I am buying an opium pipe and lighter to
bring home with me. The stores sell them and my outfit will cost about
ten dollars or about two fifty u.s. money.
The quarters where I am now are in an old temple. The Warlord
has converted the temple into a barraks and has built an aviation
field. He has ten flyable airplanes all very old and funny looking.
Last year however when he licked his Uncle at Chengtu the airplanes
just about won the war for him so he is very enthusiastic about flying
and has been a big help to us. The present war has not reached a s
stage of sufficient importance to call out the air force but hints
are now being circulated that if the other side does not come to time
pretty soon Marshall Liu will drop a few bombs.
While I am writing this letter my French host is out on the
rain drenched flying field shooting an aigret. There are lots of
those beautiful white birds there but it is not the right season for
the plumes. Also even here it is against the law to export the feathes
or whatever you call the aigrets,
You should pass the stamps on this envelope to some collector
Deb please send yours to Aud. You will notice that some characters
are stamped across the face of the stamp. The reason is that the
currency of this province is so depteciated that residents of Chungkig
have been buying stamps here with local money and shipping the stamps
to Shanghai and other points thereby reali
a profit of about ten
good only if the letter
Must stop now and pay some attention to my host who is just
coming in. Will mail this letter by airmail from chengtu tomorrow
and it will be one of the first airmail letters to be carried from
that city.
As ever Harold
properties.wof:name: correspondence: Harold M. Bixby to Debby Bixby
